title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve and protect family farms and ranches in the Jocko Valley, Camas Valley, and Mission Valley, Montana, by transferring responsibility for the operation and maintenance of the Irrigation Division of the Flathead Irrigation Project. Definitions include terms like "contract," "irrigation district," and "project." The Act aims to transfer responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes of the Flathead Nation. The Secretary of the Interior will offer a contract to the irrigation district for project management within a year of the Act's enactment. The contract will outline trust responsibilities. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes. Provisions ensure the United States fulfills trust responsibilities, maintains instream flows, and continues repayment obligations unaffected by the Act. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes, ensuring the United States fulfills trust responsibilities and repayment obligations. Amendments to repayment contracts prohibit the use of Power Division revenues for Irrigation Division costs and allow for contract revocation if the project is operated in a way that damages tribal trust assets. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes, ensuring trust responsibilities are met. Changes in operation must align with new information or policies, and negotiations should not lead to contract revocation unless the irrigation district refuses to comply. Negotiations for a contract should begin promptly to be finalized within a year of the Act's enactment. Under the contract, the Secretary will transfer ownership of equipment and supplies purchased with operation and maintenance funds to the irrigation district, excluding real property rights and water rights. The Act does not impact water rights negotiations between Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
